scenario:
In the realm of public health, a virulent outbreak is projected to claim the lives of 400 individuals in a community unless intervention occurs. Experts have outlined two equivalent response strategies: Strategy X ensures that 150 lives are saved from the outbreak. Strategy Y results in 250 lives being lost to the outbreak. Which statement most accurately captures your preference in this situation?  
A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.  
B: I somewhat prefer the positively framed option.  
C: I slightly prefer the positively framed option.  
D: I am somewhat undecided between the two options.  
E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

_run_1.text: I choose option A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.

_run_2.text: I choose option E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

scenario:
Consider a financial dilemma where an investment portfolio of $800 is anticipated to depreciate entirely due to market volatility without protective measures. Two identical safeguarding tactics are available: Tactic P locks in $300 of the portfolio's value. Tactic Q leads to a $500 loss from the portfolio. What best describes your inclination toward these tactics?  
A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.  
B: I somewhat prefer the positively framed option.  
C: I slightly prefer the positively framed option.  
D: I am somewhat undecided between the two options.  
E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

_run_1.text: I choose option A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.

_run_2.text: I choose option E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

scenario:
Environmental experts warn that pollution will eradicate 600 acres of vital wetland habitat unless immediate action is taken. They propose two comparable mitigation plans: Plan M will protect 200 acres of the habitat. Plan N will cause the destruction of 400 acres of the habitat. Which of these options most closely aligns with how you feel about the plans?  
A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.  
B: I somewhat prefer the positively framed option.  
C: I slightly prefer the positively framed option.  
D: I am somewhat undecided between the two options.  
E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

_run_1.text: I choose option A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.

_run_2.text: I choose option E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

scenario:
A new educational policy is needed because projections show that 500 students in a district will drop out without support programs. Policymakers suggest two similar initiatives: Initiative G guarantees graduation for 100 students. Initiative H means 400 students will drop out. How would you characterize your preference regarding these initiatives?  
A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.  
B: I somewhat prefer the positively framed option.  
C: I slightly prefer the positively framed option.  
D: I am somewhat undecided between the two options.  
E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

_run_1.text: I choose option A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.

_run_2.text: I choose option E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

scenario:
In a corporate marketing campaign, a product launch is expected to fail in capturing 700 potential customers due to competition unless adjusted. The team has devised two parallel promotional approaches: Approach R secures 250 customers for the product. Approach S results in losing 450 potential customers. Which choice below best represents your view on these approaches?  
A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.  
B: I somewhat prefer the positively framed option.  
C: I slightly prefer the positively framed option.  
D: I am somewhat undecided between the two options.  
E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.

_run_1.text: I choose option A: I strongly prefer the positively framed option.

_run_2.text: I choose option E: I see both options as equivalent and have no preference.
